attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2015-0454

Date: 2015-04-23

His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Industry, pursuant to subsection 12(2) of the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act, appoints the following officers of the Office of the Superintendent of Bankruptcy of the Department of Industry to hold office during pleasure as official receivers for all bankruptcy districts and divisions in Canada:

 

(a) Anisah Aish of North York, Ontario;

(b) Anne Alegre-Rock of Pickering, Ontario;

(c) Jacqueline Baker of Toronto, Ontario;

(d) Stephen Bayley of Toronto, Ontario;

(e) Ashleigh Benham of Winnipeg, Manitoba;

(f) Reyda Diego of Edmonton, Alberta;

(g) Brad Fair of Barrie, Ontario;

(h) Niveen Halawa of Keswick, Ontario;

(i) Sara Khan of Ajax, Ontario;

(j) Derek Leung of Toronto, Ontario;

(k) Wassan Manshad of Montréal, Quebec;

(l) Shemin Mawji of Dollard-des-Ormeaux, Quebec;

(m) Kelly McIntosh of Vancouver, British Columbia;

(n) Yuliya Milinkis of Montréal, Quebec; and

(o) Matthew Small of Toronto, Ontario.


 

Sur recommandation du ministre de l’Industrie et en vertu du paragraphe 12(2) de la Loi sur la faillite et l’insolvabilité, Son Excellence le Gouverneur général en conseil nomme séquestres officiels, à titre amovible, pour tous les districts et toutes les divisions des faillites au Canada, les fonctionnaires ci-après du Bureau du surintendant des faillites du ministère de l’Industrie :

 

a) Anisah Aish de North York (Ontario);

b) Anne Alegre-Rock de Pickering (Ontario);

c) Jacqueline Baker de Toronto (Ontario);

d) Stephen Bayley de Toronto (Ontario);

e) Ashleigh Benham de Winnipeg (Manitoba);

f) Reyda Diego d’Edmonton (Alberta);

g) Brad Fair de Barrie (Ontario);

h) Niveen Halawa de Keswick (Ontario);

i) Sara Khan d’Ajax (Ontario);

j) Derek Leung de Toronto (Ontario);

k) Wassan Manshad de Montréal (Québec);

l) Shemin Mawji de Dollard-des-Ormeaux (Québec);

m) Kelly McIntosh de Vancouver (Colombie-Britannique);

n) Yuliya Milinkis de Montréal (Québec);

o) Matthew Small de Toronto (Ontario).
